content:
That sounds like a fantastic experience! Speed networking events can be a great way to make connections and generate leads, and it's even more valuable when you can reconnect with people from your past, like your former professor.

It's awesome that Dr. Smith offered to introduce you to potential partners in the industry. Having a warm introduction can make a huge difference in building relationships and getting your foot in the door.

Remember to follow up with Dr. Smith and the other connections you made at the event. Send a brief email or LinkedIn message to thank them for their time and reiterate your interest in exploring potential collaborations.

Also, don't be afraid to ask for advice or guidance from your new connections. People are often more willing to help than you might think, and their insights can be incredibly valuable in helping you navigate your startup's growth.

What's your plan for following up with Dr. Smith and the other connections you made at the event? Are there any specific next steps you're planning to take?
